results.title: Simvastatin reduces MMP-3 level in interleukin 1beta stimulated human chondrocyte culture.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our data show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, by blocking @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCoA-reductase@@@ and interfering in the prenylation processes, is able to inhibit @GENE_MMP3 @GENE_4314 @@@MMP-3@@@ production from cultured @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ chondrocytes that have been either unstimulated or stimulated with @GENE_IL1B @GENE_3553 @@@IL1beta@@@, thus suggesting a possible additional mechanism for statins in counteracting chronic @<m>DISEASE_Joint_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007592 @@@joint disease@@@ related @DISEASE_Cartilage_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002357 @@@cartilage damage@@@.

citations.NLM: Lazzerini PE, Capecchi PL, Nerucci F, Fioravanti A, Chellini F, Piccini M, Bisogno S, Marcolongo R, Laghi Pasini F. Simvastatin reduces MMP-3 level in interleukin 1beta stimulated human chondrocyte culture. Ann Rheum Dis. 2004 Jul;63(7):867-9. PMID: 15194586
